title: Perma Banned Dispute
body:
Hello,

I was perma banned for inappropriate chat. I don't believe I deserve the punishment that was given to me. I honestly make mistakes I am human but this is going to far. 


This was the chat from the game below. Only one game chat log was provided. Also I was banned for 14 days but it was removed by a Riot employee since they did not believe the punishment was deserved. So from this chat it escalated me to a perma ban apparently. Riot support was no help and refused to help giving blanket statements about closing the ticket and sorry.

Let me know what you think after reading this chat log. I admit I am not the best chatter in league but I am definitely not the worst .006%. I feel I am the victim of multiple issues with Riots report system and that something of this magnitude should not remove a player completely from their account. Time and money aside that is my identity in the game and I feel like it was stolen by an imperfect system that doesn't look at all the variables. 

For instance I even apologized for my actions in that chat. Is that not what someone that realized they made a mistake would do? I would just like someone to review the case and look at the missing pieces... are we not suppose to say anything when a player is running it down or refusing to assist the team? I am sure we all get heated when someone is refusing to help in a 5v5. I asked support for a little forgiveness seeing that this is not the worst chat in league it is actually pretty normal in most games I play(not from me) and I don't report it because it is a game and I have a mute button if I don't want to see it.

Game 1
Pre-Game
Macanica: lol mid and top gives me support
Macanica: anyone want to switch and let me carry?
Macanica: nah
In-Game
Macanica: sorry tech issues
Macanica: got him
Macanica: what you doing man?
Macanica: draven is def a bronze
Macanica: nah carrying bot
Macanica: draven doesnt know how to spin axews
Macanica: not the point
Macanica: he doesnt know that champion
Macanica: nah
Macanica: cool you already are
Macanica: cool bronze man
Macanica: nah dude bronze 100% players
Macanica: why are you a bad adC?
Macanica: am i ?
Macanica: I am silver and and I am not complete trash
Macanica: i mean everyone but you can play
Macanica: 1/3/6
Macanica: lowest cs
Macanica: draven dude you find the map to anything yet?
Macanica: i mean you just earned a report so its whatever
Macanica: im sure everyone else feels the same
Macanica: yeah you bad
Macanica: confirmed
Macanica: just report the noob
Macanica: when he gets banned and get deranked to bronze he will learn
Macanica: cool then get to making boy
Macanica: draven is just salty
Macanica: draven 1/7 best adc
Macanica: na
Macanica: get a kill and ill be quie
Macanica: omg soooo bad!
Macanica: what you doing stopping!
Macanica: Even when I give you kills you cant do it!
Macanica: you sir deserve bronze forever
Macanica: you are talentless
Macanica: you must have just learned to paly
Macanica: dont worry bout that guy he will figure it out soon. Look Draven sorry for being  mean lets just win this and go our separate w
Macanica: they will end...
Macanica: no idea what is going on
Macanica: and gg
Post-Game
Macanica: ggwp
Macanica: yeah adc lowest damage on team
Macanica: gg

This was the chat from the game.

This chat log is punishable. You're being rude to Draven for no reason, calling him bronze/rank shaming, pointing out his kda. You deserved a punishment.

For this to be a perma ban means you recently had a 14 day ban. Which means you more than likely already had 3 prior punishments telling you this was bad, as well as a warning that after the 14 day ban you would be perma banned.

So, it was deserved. You didn't learn your lesson, now you're dealing with the consequences.

Not trying to say you can't do it but it is also trolling in a way. You basically started a ranked game with a player that you knew would under perform and you didn't let us know. You let us walk into that with no warning. I would say maybe say what you said here next time so that no one says anything to him.

I understand your frustrations. He was already playing ranked matches by himself and I just joined in to play with him. Normally I wouldn't want to learn a new role/champ in ranked eitber. But unfortunately there's nothing we can really do about what que players choose to play in. I guess it's just part of the game we have to accept sadly. Sorry for the report.

Hey everything happens for a reason. I needed a break and this is why. Currently there is to much trolling and lax players in ranked which lead good people to be toxic. When you are honestly trying to climb and you have nothing but bad games with bad players(AFK, trolling, feeders) it gets hard to stay positive. I make mistakes and I am willing to accept the consequences. I still don't agree with Riot that chat is something that should remove a player 100% from a game but I don't get to make those calls. 

Maybe a permanent chat disable following a 90 day to 1 year re-eval? If player shows no negative behavior from having chat removed after so long then in my opinion  that shows reform. How will you know someone has reformed if you don't give them the chance? Also this game isn't about chat and is a consistent issue so why not allow the option to turn it off before a game begins without having to type /mute all? 

I am not saying being toxic is ok but I think a lot of players have been negatively judged by their piers. For instance @KFCeytron it seems some people will just jump at these posts to tear others down that are already down and act like they have never done anything wrong. Justifying why you are posting "I really hope you don't make a new account, because your attitude and behavior are not desired here." is something that would also not be desired in chat since it is not constructive it is only destructive. The whole community has a sickness and a lot of people should have been perma banned as well but some people feel the need to report every thing even when it isn't that bad while others do not. We live in a care bear society where everything said hurts someones feelings and therefore you should be punished for it.
Bronze insults are so 2018....use iron 4 next time man. If you are gonna get banned for being a D. Atleast stay on trend plox.

Haha wood 4?

It hurts peoples feelings to be called a rank. Maybe I meant bronze as a good thing? It does have a nice color to it.

Yeah, there's not much you can do. The game in its current state skew towards encouraging negative behaviours because riot is doing very little to promote positive actions.  There is less incentive to be good. Punishment works only to the extent of hiding resentments. I see plenty of that same rhetoric on this board too. 

League has morphed into one of the largest competitive e-sports on the planet, with it the high pressure to perform. As all things competition goes, it is naturally a stressful environment.

Exactly my kind sir. 

I don't think what I did was right and I would take it back if I could but we can't and what is done is done. It is definitely tough on most players because of the system, but we have to work with it if we want to play I guess. There are just different types of people in the world and some people can let things go and just sit there for 15-45 mins of trolling and not say anything while others with less time at their disposal get a little more upset feeling as if their time was stolen. the 15 min surrender is nice if the troll votes yes.... Also you can't go AFK and do something else because that is bad. So you really have no option but to suck it up and lose your valuable time quietly. That is the part I want to shed some light on. If this is a reoccurring theme shouldn't we look at the causes and try to eliminate them instead of fussing over chat. Yes chat can have a negative impact and should still count towards a punishment, but more than anything if a chat infraction is caused by another player there should be some reduction/leeway. I have known so many good players and people that quit this game because they got tired of the trolls and being unable to say anything for fear of a ban. It is censorship at its greatest! Don't say what you are thinking unless you phrase it in a creative way that sounds like constructive feed back. 

Example: Hey Draven, I know you are trying your best but can we try to play more passive?

Sounds great right? But wrong this is still insulting. You are saying they are to aggressive and they can take it as an insult and become more aggressive...

There is no winning. Silence is the winner which is like saying turn the other check as everything you love is being taken from you. I have limited time to play so losing a whole hour of my day to a troll is a huge blow. So I have decided to stop playing no matter the outcome of my trial with Riot. I would like my account to still be playable one day, but I dont mind if that is 90 days+ or never it will just settle the issue because I won't grind up another account I will just move on to another game. 

P.S. Battlerite is way more fun and faster paced. No trolls and if they are trolling its over quick.

Wishing someone lost a lot of money is not needed here or anywhere and I believe you could do with a little time off as well.

The problem i have is whether you said sorry to the draven or to try and cover yourself in chat logs.

I mean it was just a fact. The ADC did have the lowest damage on team. That isn't flaming in most peoples opinions on the forum. Truth is not flame it is just a statistic. I also didn't say sorry to save myself I said sorry to get him to stop trolling and hopefully come mid to help the team for 1 time in the game. I admit I flamed him but at the same time another player was refusing to assist the team and has not been punished. What is worse the guys with words or the guys with the action? If I talk about it or do it what is worse?

That is all that I am saying. Yes saying things is bad but purposely throwing a game is way worse.

1.) Never played champion or position
2.) Didn't advise team he was trying something new.
3.)After dying he started flaming me after I picked up the kills.
4.) Decided to no longer help team and just farm bot lane for 20 mins.
4.) His flame and lack of communication was the match that started the fire and spiraled the whole game out of control. It wasn't just me flaming either. Every single player except his friend was mad and telling him things. So why is it that all of that is ok and excusable is my point? 

I said things I shouldn't have and honestly deserve the 14 day suspension since I never received one officially. Also even though I said something I didn't "do" anything to negatively impact the rest of the team. I worked with them and even sucked up my pride and apologized to the troll to try and win the game for everyone. So if this is the kind of behavior that you don't want then so be it have fun with the trolls and the real people that ruin the game. When you blow up and get banned you will be back and think differently.

_Everything you said_ over the _entire match_ was to put down a teammate. _**THE WHOLE TIME. THAT'S ALL YOU DID.**_

I really hope you don't make a new account, because your attitude and behavior are not desired here.
Thanks man exactly what you just did right there in your comment. Seems I am not the only one that does it. Already knew I messed up but thanks for your time.

There is no difference. What you are doing is the same thing. Your first post would have been constructive feedback if you didn't say you hope I don't make a new account because you don't want me to play. That is a vindictive statement that was unnecessary just like calling someone "bronze".

Going so long without saying anything like this does show a change... you are ignoring the facts your behavior on this forum is something the community does not need. You can't tell the difference between malice and explaining why you are banned, when you literally asked us to tell you what we think. This is not shame for its own sake. I am telling you that your chat was unacceptable, and therefore you are banned, just like Riot's ban message no doubt tried to explain, but the message isn't getting through.

First-timing a champ in ranked is not a bannable offense. Being bad at LoL is not a bannable offense. Ripping into someone over an entire match is a bannable offense, and that's what you did, so you are banned. If you were in charge of the rules, perhaps things would be different, but you're not, so they aren't.

One chat log like this in a month is actually a lot. Some people go months, years, or even indefinitely without being this toxic. The fact that your punishment was escalated all the way to a permaban means that it wasn't just one slip-up - your record isn't cleared every few weeks. If you can't go even a month without berating someone for an hour, that's just not good enough, which is why you are banned.

I don't know how you're concluding that my behavior is something the community does not need, or what in the world it has to do with your punishment and the feedback you requested. This attention I'm giving you is a favor: I'm not being paid, and the only person it could possibly help is you. Maybe you'll realize that other people have deemed you behavior inappropriate, and that this is a time for you to change your behavior rather than deflect and defend and argue. It is a useful skill in dealing with people.

Thank you for stopping in. You also refuse to see what you say also is toxic in nature. Wishing someone that they will not be un-banned for everyones sake or that they are toxic based off of one chat is rude and childish. I am saying you had good points you just ruined it with negative responses. 

"I really hope you don't make a new account, because your attitude and behavior are not desired here." - This is like saying, "please uninstall you are not wanted in this game because I saw one chat log". How quick you seem to jump on someone without even realizing you do the same thing as what you are hounding them about. Ironic isn't it?

 If you can't see that you as well are insulting others via chat and being hypocritical than that is ok by me I don't know how I can be anymore clear on the subject. I am not denying that what I said was toxic and I am not saying I did not do something wrong. I did ask for advice and opinions but I did not say to come here and flame me. If you can't understand this then just leave the discussion because you aren't saying anything beneficial anymore.

No, it's like saying "your behavior is terrible, but you don't think it's terrible, and you don't even accept that others find it terrible, so you kept behaving like that and now you are banned for good reason." If you make a new account and start all over again it'll bother even more people, so I hope you can at least avoid doing that.

> [{quoted}](name=Macanica,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=c4Tk7R3c,comment-id=00020000000100000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-11-20T17:22:05.584+0000)

If you can't understand this then just leave the discussion because you aren't saying anything beneficial anymore.

Banning you is not an insult. Explaining that you are banned is not an insult. The 30-45 minutes of toxic sludge you dumped on your teammate did, in fact, largely comprise insults. So you are banned.

My behavior (which is perfectly fine, by the way, although I understand that you think "poor behavior" means "anything that makes Macanica feel bad") has nothing to do with any of this and really doesn't help your case. Do you think that if support actually came in here to review your case (which they won't, by the way) they'd be happy to see you raging and arguing at people whom you specifically asked for feedback?

You were banned for your behavior. Your behavior was bad. Complaining about the rules doesn't help. Complaining about other people doesn't help.
